intro: Eriolytrum junceum, commonly known as slender false brome, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, spike-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as meadows and grasslands. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it produces small, pale blue or purple flowers. Eriolytrum junceum is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and support local wildlife.
